intro: Stephanophysum attenuatum, commonly known as the slender stephanophysum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to regions of southern Africa, this plant typically grows in open, sandy or gravelly soils. The leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is often cultivated for its delicate appearance and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
